perturbation.original_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.1. AFFILIATE shall mean, when used with reference to a party, any
individual or entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under
common control with such party. For purposes of this definition, "control" means
the direct or indirect ownership of at least 50% of the outstanding voting
securities of a party, or the right to control the policy decisions of such
party.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.1. AFFILIATE shall mean, when used with reference to a party, any
individual or entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under
common control with such party. For purposes of this definition, "control" means
the direct or indirect ownership of at least 25% of the outstanding voting
securities of a party, or the right to control the policy decisions of such
party.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Affiliate' is changed by lowering the percentage of ownership required for control from 50% to 25%. This creates ambiguity as to what constitutes an affiliate, impacting clauses that rely on this definition, like assignment or confidentiality obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
5.   TERMINATION AND RENEWAL
     5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall
end fifteen months therefrom.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.   TERMINATION AND RENEWAL
     5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall
end fifteen months therefrom, unless one party provides 30 days written notice of renewal. This agreement will automatically renew for subsequent 15 month periods.
perturbation.explanation: Section 5.1 now states that it will automatically renew unless notice is given. This creates ambiguity since the normal reading for a contract term is that it ends with no additional obligation. This may be challenged if one party does not want to renew.

perturbation.original_text:
7.3. TERMINATION. Subject to Section 10.11  [SURVIVAL], upon termination of this
Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing
party or, at the request of the disclosing party, destroyed unless otherwise
specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. Subject to Section 7.6  [USER DATA],
the confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 7  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall survive
termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.3. TERMINATION. Subject to Section 10.11  [SURVIVAL], upon termination of this
Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing
party or, at the request of the disclosing party, destroyed unless otherwise
specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. Subject to Section 7.6  [USER DATA],
the confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 7  [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall not survive
termination of this Agreement. All information can be shared.
perturbation.explanation: The clause clearly states that after termination, confidentiality obligations last for 3 years. By modifying it so that obligations do not survive, this impacts IP protection and trade secrets after termination of agreement. This can lead to uncertainty and potential disputes.
